page.title: 06Mining at Welbeck in the 40s
page.content: Mr.Tom Moody is a Deputy at Welbeck Colliery.He began work there as a 14 year_old school leaver.Although he had passed entrance examinations for a grammar school place , home circumstances forced him to begin work. When he began in 1943 the pits were run by private companies and the majority of the work was done by man- power.Few safety precautions were taken and Mr.Moody says that of the 900,000 men employed at the time over 1500 were killed every year. Before nationalisation the colliery was owned by the New Hucknall and Blackwell Co.By 1947 the pits had been nationalized ,Mr. Moody began working a 5 day week,and was paid 6 shifts for 5.The shortage of fuel however led to Saturday and Sunday overtime working.
